publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-373# Sarah Boyack: Older People's Week 2003—That the Parliament notes that Older People's Week takes place between 27 September and 3 October 2003, including Older Persons’ Day on 1 October; welcomes the activities across Scotland that recognise and celebrate the contribution of older people to our society; congratulates local authorities such as the City of Edinburgh Council in the partnership work which has produced a city plan for older people; welcomes the strategic aims outlined in A City for All Ages to improve opportunities and access to services and tackle discrimination, and considers that the Scottish Executive should continue to support older people to live healthy, active and independent lives.

S2M-373# Older People's Week 2003 (lodged on 22 September 2003) Scott Barrie*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Susan Deacon*, Jackie Baillie*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr Richard Baker*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Christine May*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Elaine Smith*, Karen Gillon*, Johann Lamont*, Pauline McNeill*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-373# Older People's Week 2003 (lodged on 22 September 2003) Helen Eadie*, Marlyn Glen*, Donald Gorrie*, Karen Whitefield*, Trish Godman*, John Swinburne*
S2M-373# Older People's Week 2003 (lodged on 22 September 2003) Marilyn Livingstone*, Janis Hughes*

S2M-373# Sarah Boyack: Older People's Week 2003-That the Parliament notes that Older People's Week takes place between 27 September and 3 October 2003, including Older Persons' Day on 1 October; welcomes the activities across Scotland that recognise and celebrate the contribution of older people to our society; congratulates local authorities such as the City of Edinburgh Council in the partnership work which has produced a city plan for older people; welcomes the strategic aims outlined in A City for All Ages to improve opportunities and access to services and tackle discrimination, and considers that the Scottish Executive should continue to support older people to live healthy, active and independent lives. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Susan Deacon, Jackie Baillie, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Richard Baker, Cathie Craigie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Christine May, Ms Wendy Alexander, Dr Elaine Murray, Elaine Smith, Karen Gillon, Johann Lamont, Pauline McNeill, Maureen Macmillan, Helen Eadie, Marlyn Glen, Donald Gorrie, Karen Whitefield, Trish Godman, John Swinburne, Marilyn Livingstone, Janis Hughes, Mike Watson*, Cathy Peattie*
S2M-373# Older People's Week 2003 (lodged on 22 September 2003) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-373# Older People's Week 2003 (lodged on 22 September 2003) Ms Sandra White*
